page.title: 01General Description
page.content: The village of Woolton Hill is situated in the parish of East Woodhay.The parish is made up of lots of different hamlets such as Woolton Hill, Broad Layings, The Mount, Hollington, East End, Ball Hill, Hat Common, North End, Gore End and part of Highclere.The northen boundary of the parish is the River Enbourne and the southern boundary runs along The Ridgeway.The parish is in the northen Hampshire lowlands.Although the A.343 runs nearby it is still a fairly rural area but is growing in population, because the M.4 and the inter city trains make London easily accessible. It is four miles south of Newbury which is the nearest shopping area.
